Description: This registry defines the common messages for HPE RESTful API implementations.

ArrayPropertyOutOfBound.Description: The items in the array exceed the maximum  number supported.
ArrayPropertyOutOfBound.Message: An array %1 was supplied with %2 items that exceeds the maximum supported count of %3.
ArrayPropertyOutOfBound.Resolution: Retry the operation using the correct number of items for the array.

ConditionalSuccess.Description: A property value was successfully changed but the change may be reverted upon system reset.
ConditionalSuccess.Message: The property %1 was successfully changed to %2, but the change may be reverted upon system reset.
ConditionalSuccess.Resolution: Check the "SettingsResult" messages after the system has reset for errors referring to the corresponding property.

InternalErrorWithParam.Description: The operation was not successful due to an internal service error (shown), but the service is still operational.
InternalErrorWithParam.Message: The operation was not successful due to an internal service error (%1), but the service is still operational.
InternalErrorWithParam.Resolution: Retry the operation. If the problem persists, consider resetting the service.

InvalidConfigurationSpecified.Description: The specified configuration is not valid.
InvalidConfigurationSpecified.Message: The specified configuration is not valid.
InvalidConfigurationSpecified.Resolution: Correct the configuration, and then retry the operation.

PropertyValueExceedsMaxLength.Description: The value for the property exceeds the maximum length.
PropertyValueExceedsMaxLength.Message: The value %1 for the property %2 exceeds the maximum length of %3.
PropertyValueExceedsMaxLength.Resolution: Correct the value for the property in the request body, and then retry the operation.

PropertyValueIncompatible.Description: The value for the property is the correct type, but this value is incompatible with the current value of another property.
PropertyValueIncompatible.Message: The value %1 for the property %2 is incompatible with the value for property %3.
PropertyValueIncompatible.Resolution: Correct the value for the property in the request body, and then retry the operation.

PropertyValueOutOfRange.Description: The value for the property is out of range.
PropertyValueOutOfRange.Message: The value %1 for the property %2 is out of range %3.
PropertyValueOutOfRange.Resolution: Correct the value for the property in the request body, and then retry the operation.

ResetInProgress.Description: A device or service reset is in progress.
ResetInProgress.Message: A reset on %1 is in progress.
ResetInProgress.Resolution: Wait for device or service reset to complete, and then retry the operation.

ResetRequired.Description: One or more properties were changed, but these changes will not take effect until the device or service is reset.
ResetRequired.Message: One or more properties were changed, but these changes will not take effect until %1 is reset.
ResetRequired.Resolution: To enable the changed properties, reset the device or service.

ResourceNotReadyRetry.Description: The resource is present but is not ready to perform operations due to an internal condition such as initialization or reset.
ResourceNotReadyRetry.Message: The resource is present but is not ready to perform operations.  The resource will be ready in %1 seconds.
ResourceNotReadyRetry.Resolution: Retry the operation when the resource is ready.

TaskCreated.Description: A task was created in response to the operation.
TaskCreated.Message: A task was created in response to the operation and is accessible at %1.
TaskCreated.Resolution: Perform an HTTP GET request on the supplied URI for task status.

UnsupportedHwConfiguration.Description: A previously requested property value change was reverted because the current hardware configuration does not support it.
UnsupportedHwConfiguration.Message: The value %1 for property %2 was reverted because the current hardware configuration does not support it.
UnsupportedHwConfiguration.Resolution: Ensure that the system's hardware configuration supports the property value.

Name: HPE Common Message Registry
